author: Legoman1993
title: Great little Sub scooter!
review:
I really like the sub scooter! 
                                   Pros: great sub!,{cool reef! Neon green!} a good variety of treasure and a Skull head! comes with 2 filppers and two harpoon guns!and a nice computer piece!.         Cons: no cons! 
   
      If you want a little sub scooter and a variety of treasure get this one! I recommend this set to all aquaraider Fans!

author: David1971
title: Excellent little set
review: This is an excellent, wonderful little set. The little craft is beautifully designed, really nice, and it comes with the treasure chest *and* snakes *and* that little bit of sea bed and plant-life. A really nice set and you feel like Lego have been generous to you with the lovely design and 75 pieces in the box.

author: A_Brickset_user
title: Great Set!!
review: I just got this set and it is awesome! Its got 2 sea snakes 1 treasure chest a blue and a green gem + 4 coins. The diver is cool with his harpoons and so is the submarine. my only complaint is that they don't have the right thing. It should have the angler.

author: CyandraZ
title: This one's a surefire winner!
review:
Aquaraiders is probably the best theme of the January 2007 lineup, and this kit tops all the others. Why? Simply because virtually lego fan will enjoy this set if they purchase it. First off, the parts per piece ratio is better than average, and virtually every piece is very useable. The yellow curved slopes, robot arms, trans green seaweed, and printed tail are the highlights, and the kit has lots of accessories (Beautiful divers helmet and snorkel, dark gray oxygen tank, flippers, 2 harpoons, treasure chest, two gems, 4 coins, a skull, and two red snakes). The model itself is a beauty, since it is a perfect melding of classic and modern building techniques. The sub is clever and sleek, and the plant structure looks like it came right out of the Divers theme. Finally, the figure is amazing! A modern version of a Diver figure, with cool printing on the torso and helmet and a cool color scheme! Overall, this kit is literally perfect. I couldn’t expect anything more from a $5 USD kit, and I highly recommend it to all adult, teen, and kid fans of Lego alike! 5/5 – Perfect!

P.S. Although many people dislike the color change, I really think it works great with themes like Starwars and Aquaraiders – it’s a lot more metallic or stone looking! ;)

author: legozander
title: A package of fun
review:
This is my first (and only) aquaraiders set. I really like it.

The minifig in the set comes with a cool diving suit with a neat little design on it. I like the colour of his visor as well.

The little jet scooter I really like. It even has two black robot arms from Exo-Force! The're handy for grabbing those sea-snakes... :P
 
On the subject of the sea-snakes their nothing new. Funny, I never knew sea snakes came with rattles....

The dark grey rock is nothing interesting. I like the seaweed bit on it. On the box the seaweed looked like a solid green colour to me, but when I opened the set it turned out to be see-through green!

The treasure chest is a nifty little thing. I quite like it.

The treasure is cool. You get four gold coins, two gems and- a skull? Yeah, very valuable. LOL. :P
So overall this is a great little set and it is well worth getting. I recommend it!

author: mrmitch
title: Great gift for the Lego fan in your life
review: This set can't be beat. It is affordable has cool pieces, good looking mini figure, and is fun to play with. I got all 10 of my Tiger Cubs this set as a graduation gift into the Wolf den next year(BSA). Can't beat this set for value and fun.

author: David1985
title: Great Cheap Set!
review:
75 Pieces
$4.99

Overall Set...

Pieces…

There are 75 pieces for only $5. With the 75 pieces you get two red snakes, a blue and green jewel, a skeleton head, and 4 gold coins. The front have two robot arms with “wrench” pieces to pick things up with. There is a trans-green seaweed piece. You can never get enough of those.

Minifig…

The minifig is nice. A printed helment with a nice light blue, black yellow mix for the overall minifig. I guess the head is an old one, but I like it. I see no need for Lego to make special characters for themes like Knight’s Kingdom and Exo-Force. Lego until 15 years ago just had the simple smilie face and they worked fine. All the Aqua Raiders have the same diver suit too, so you can make a little army of them, but that might displease some.

Special things…

NO STICKERS! I will repeat NO STICKERS! There is a computer tile and a back fin that says Sub Deep Diver. It’s great to not have any stickers.

When you see this set, buy it! Buy two of them!

author: Aleiobot
title: Well -
review:
This set is ok - I mean it is a little small but still pretty fun to play with :0 

    The good:
1:Cool mini sub
2:good amount of pieces
3:lots of treasure. Arrg!
4:Only 5.00$
5:Nice minifigure and weapons (Harpoon guns
6:Pretty cool ocean floor piece with seaweed

    The bad:
1:Little set
2:the snakes should have been made better
3:treasure and skull won't stay in chest

This is just my point of view for the set, so if you are a Aqua Raider fan you should definetly get this set!

author: Blade
title: A Tru Little Ripper
review:
Well i bought this set over a week ago and it took me a few days to get around to building it and this long to review it. :( 

Well lets start with the name, Aqua Raiders. Very nice and cant be confused with the Aquanauts. The price was the thing that stunned me. like $6 at the local K-Mart. This set is of fair size and a fair few pieces.

The sub itself is awesome. the shape size and detail of this model truly stuns me and i feel the box dose not do it justice. The vehicle itself is very aesthetically pleasing with nice shapes and curves and features everywhere like: It has moving claws at the front which are perfect for catching the sea snakes or picking up the treasure chest or holding the spear guns. 

Dual Front Lasers, Spear guns which attach so nicely to the side of the vehicle making them practical not just shoved somewhere. The control panel is on a hinge, which is great for the position of the mini-fig. Flippers attached in a good accessible spot, The tail fin is printed not stickered so extra points there and it even has a rudder, which works nicely considering it is only attached by one clip.

The mini-fig is blue and black all over and they have even put colour detail into the figs back which is very uncommon. He has an oxygen tank so a mask with a snorkel dose seem a little stupid but the colour is appropriate so I can over look that.

As for the extras The small ground piece was a good addition and i know the treasure chest doesn't fit on it but its an extra! Consider the model without it? Also I feel they were trying not to make it too much like the piece from set 6555. The sea snakes are nice yes could have used a bigger animal but they did give us two. The treasure chest has a nice combination of crystals and gold which is what treasure chests always should have been. The skull is for good measure.

Overall I feel there really nothing you can complain about with this set. Ok bigger animal, better ground piece, extra fig, but that would make it a $15 - $20 model and really if you just got the sub it would still be worth the $6 so dont complain. For such a small model I cant believe it is so good and really it is flawless so I feel for once a small model truly deserves a 10/10 boarding on an 11 because that is just how impressed i am with this model and coming from an old school fan that is saying something. Who ever you are, What ever you play with or collect, get this one just because it is so worth it.

author: benners30
title: beautiful
review:
this is a great and cheap set for a very low price. it comes with lots of usefull parts and some rare pieces

it also come with some seaweed on a rock for landscape which is always good.
it has lots of jewels and yellow pieces and a pretty cool looking diver.

overall great set

author: bmwlego
title: Tiny Little Set Looks Cool
review: This set was mailed as part of my Brickmaster subscription! I was a little annoyed that I could have just bought it at a store but it is a nic small set. The minifig is detailed, there is a snake and translucent green plant part, a treasure chest filled with coins, crystals and a skull and the vehicle is cool too. The use of technic beams and axles to attach the propellers to the vehicle are cool. Even the tiny sets are incorporating technic parts. The yellow slopes at the front of the vehicle are nice parts. I can't believe I passed up this set when it was on clearance for 98 cents at Target. I went back the next morning to buy the 4 that were on the shelves and they were gone. It would have been worth the price just for the minifigs and yellow sloped parts. This set also has printed parts (the tail and a 1x2 tile for the control console). A good buy for 5 bucks.

author: Shadow_Crawler
title: COOL!
review:
Box = 5/5
Very good, with the snakes attacking the sub and the treasure behind them.

Building = 4/5
Too easy to build, but it's exciting to build the sub.

Playability = 4/5
Not much too say, only you can open/close the treasure box and "attack" the sub with the snakes.

Overall = 4/5
Nice small set, with a cheap price you get a big sub, even bigger than in 7771.

Pros :
Not even a single sticker available
Nice treasures

Cons : 
Only 2 snakes (Imagine if there's a horde of them!)

author: Gus_263
title: Easy to build and play
review:
This set was from the last year (2007), and was one small set from aqua raiders theme, a new version of the aqua zone theme, but with many differences in many things. But these differet things don't frustrated the theme at all, and this is one of the cool sets that have something to looks like with the classic aqua zone. 

The set basically includes a scenery, vehicle, the minifigure, treasures and two snakes to increase the scenery, altough these snakes can't moves. The scenery is basically a piece to looks like with seaweed, used too as other plants on other sets, in themes under the sea or above the ground. This piece is located above a glowing dark green cone piece and next to grey bricks and ramp pieces above a gray plate. The treasure chest contains one skull, four coins and two gems, one blue other green, and the two snakes are red. The minifigure have dive accessories, and the colors and printed details on this makes this useful for sets in water environment, but the colors aren't that great, and were very repeated on this theme. 

The vehicle too includes different pieces like the special plates to keeps some pieces with claws that can hold things like the minifigures' hands, those pieces that were used as the arms of the exo-force's robots. A special plate too located on the center of the vehicle keeps two plates at one side and ramp pieces on the front of the set. Is easy see two black plates between the ramp pieces and the "arms", and these are very next to the other plates. 

Two harpoons are placed on the vehicle by claw pies on the sides, and these are useful too as tools. On the left and right of the set, have some pieces like the glowing blue ones connected by pieces common on technic sets to propellers and too the main part of the vehicle. This have also a control panel that can moves to the minifigure, placed very well on the set. On the back of the vehicle keep placed plates with sticks to keep a black piece and in the left of the set, another accessories. The logo of aqua raiders is printed on the back of the set, and this is useful basically for yellow or underwater sets. 

This set is easy to build and have the playability of the aquazone sets, where are minifigures can dive with or without vehicles, searching for treasures. The colors are too repetitive, but something on them are cool. The arms on the front can be considered as innovations, but any minifigure in the original shape can hangs something like they. This in overall deserves a 4.6 of 5. It have 75 cool pieces and is very playable, a great set.

author: donneyboy
title: nice set, cheap set
review: this is a nice set. it is very cheap. i went to a wal-mart and bought 2 of them. not bad 150 pieces for 10 bucks. i'm thinking about getting 2 or 4 more. all in all it is a nice set and defiantly and i mean defiantly worth your money. i mean 75 pieces for 5 bucks

author: Lint
title: Nice little builder
review:
Unfortunately I am not an aqua raiders collector so this set presents little value to me. Overall it looks to be a nice little builder set which contains a decent amount of accessories as well as an aqua raider minifig.

PROS

  • Lots of accessories. Treasure galore, two snakes and two spearguns
  • Nice assortment of parts, mostly the accessories already mentioned
  • The undersea hunter looks cool with manipulator arms, two large torch beams and dual propellors
  • A good aqua raiders builder set. Fair value for money.

CONS

  • Overall quite boring as a stand-alone play value
  • Not overly interesting to build

Overall this set is not bad but doesn't offer much stand-alone play or construction value. The designs are cool and you get some nifty parts. I would get this if you have or are intending to get other aqua raiders sets.

author: vezon8764
title: Explorer of the deep!
review:
I only had this set- got it free with a Brickmaster subscription- but this really makes me want to get the whole collection! IT IS GREAT! Before I go too far, let me go into the pros and cons:
Pros:
My first Diver maskpiece, fins and tank!
My first seaweed piece!
I don't exactly have a lot of green crystals, so this helps with the treasure!
Excelent design!
Cons:
The whole series has too many minifigures, and the whole series uses only four characters! There must be at least 3 of this diver's heads in the Aqua Raider's series!
Snakes... pointless. You can't really get them to get into the claws and stay there.
You have to take off the fins off the back of the scuba, and the harpoons, to get him into his actual diver form. Can't he be hanging off the back with some handles, like in some other sets? I already remade this set to do that, and it looks much better!
Skull is hard to have in the closed treasure chest with treasure.
Overall: 4.8/5
Note: GET IF YOU CAN!
See you next review!

author: Z_wing
title: if only indiana jones sets were as cheap as this
review:
my last review was not great so I will make this one better. this set has almost as much pieces as the new ambush in cairo set but is twice as cheap!
must be the licence for indiana jones

figure

cons: none

cons: none

treaure
pros: lots of it

rocks
pros: looks nice
cons: none

pieces

cons: rocks are weak

price
pros: cheap, worth it
cons: none

I recommend this set to any aqua raiders II fan
I hope you found my review helpful

author: KLOKRIECHER
title: LEGO Aqua Raiders - Deep Sea Treasure Hunter
review:
The Deep Sea Treasure Hunter (7770) is a LEGO Aqua Raiders set which came out in 2007. It comes with 1 minifig and 75 pieces. This set does include no decals and there're no mistakes in the instructions and no missing pieces.

[img]http://www.klokriecher.de/gallery_pics/l/7770-1.jpg[/img]


Minifigures:

Diver: The diver comes with a black helmet with a blue stripe on it and a pair of goggles. This minifig as a dark gray air tank and a dark gray harpoon. His torso is double-printed and on his face you can see black hair and a beard.


Deep Sea Treasure Hunter:

The deep sea treasure hunter is very easy to build. We get a pile of rocks with a plant and a brown treasure chest with a skull, 4 gold coints and 2 gems in it. There're also 2 red snakes in this set. The little sub looks very cool and it's very sturdy. On the back you can see the black fins and on each side you can find a dark gray harpoon and the engine with a gun in the front. In the front you can see 2 arms which sviwel and the computer on the top of this sub does sviwel too. It's a very neat set to pick up and it's a great starter set for young LEGO builders.



Positive:

Great pieces which you can youse for brickfilms or MOC's
Minifig
Nice starter set
No stickers
Treasure


Negative:

Not so many play features




All in all it's a great set to get and I would highly recommend you to get this model. You can find this set on eBay, BrickLink and Amazon for sure. Here is the link where you can check out the full galery I made for this set on my website: http://www.klokriecher.de

Videos I made of this set:

Stopmotion
Review

author: Ha876

review: i think this set is good for beginners because it comes with a minifigure with 2 guns, treasure chest with gold coins and gems and the vehicle has good features for playability. I would give this set a 7/10 for myself but a 8.5/10 for someone younger.

author: NickBrick
title: Now this is a $5 set
review: The main part of the set is of course the sea jet thingy which is quite nice and large for the price.The sea snakes are cool and quite rare.The robot arms can grab the snakes to.The set comes with that piece of undersea floor with seaweed and the trans-green is awesome.Here's just a hint of how rare the chest is.I have over fifty Lego sets and this is the only set with a chest included.The diver has my favorite face.The skeloton head is a nice little extra.I give this set a thumbs up 5 stars.I give the Aqua raiders series a 5 to.

author: Nicko727
title: Aqua Raiders in Retrospect - Deep Sea Treasure Hunter
review:
Aqua Raiders #7770: Deep Sea Treasure Hunter is the ideal $5.00 Lego set, from its simple build and quantity of play features, it is exactly what one would expect with a set of its value. I first obtained this set back in 2007 when I was a child, and at the time, it was another awesome vehicle to add to my fleet of Aqua Raiders sets. Looking back on it (and the series as a whole), I am pleased with the amount of enjoyment I got out of such a simple set. 


Parts Selection: 

For such a small set, the Treasure Hunter offers a wide selection of interesting parts, and quite surprisingly, NO stickers. There are two printed items, the tail fin of the scooter itself, and this part also adorns vehicles in a few other sets in this range, and the control panel, which is found in a wide range of sets. Aside from this however, there is not much else to say about the exclusivity of the pieces found here. 

The Minifigure:

Well, he’s an Aqua Raiders diver, and there is not much else to say about him. He shares the helmet, scuba tank, and wetsuit with all the other figures in this range, and his head appears in two other Aqua Raiders sets. His torso features some lovely detail, including diving belts and the theme’s trident logo. His legs are plain, but that can simply be attributed to the printing technology of the time.  

The Build: 

As can be expected with a $5.00 set, the build is nothing to write home about. However, it does offer a small range of technic pieces, which is uncommon for a set of its size. There is a small rock structure included in the set, which is rather common in the Aqua Raiders theme. It consists of a few bricks and slopes of varying grays, and a bit of seaweed. Unlike other rocks in this series, however, there is no treasure to be found on it. The treasure itself is contained entirely in a chest, which is delightful. The contents of the chest include a skull, two gems, and a handful of chrome gold coins. 

The sea scooter itself is relatively compact, and includes a pair of spear-guns which can be removed for use with the minifig. The aforementioned technic pieces form the propeller shafts and a torpedo-looking structure. Between the propellers, a rudder is formed with a small quadrangle-esque flag, which is a technique that is rather common in this theme. There are two hooks which are used for the storage of the diver’s swim fins, and this is a very nice addition to the set. At the front of the vehicle, there are two small manipulator arms, which I would often use to keep the sea snakes at bay when I played with this set. I would imagine they could also be used for grasping the treasure, but my mind never went there! 

Issues:

I have found two primary issues with this set. Firstly, the torpedo heads (or whatever they’re supposed to be) would often fall off when I played, and because of this, I would often just leave them off until I was done. The second issue is with the propellers. After years of use, the tan frictionless pin that they are attached to has started to warp, and because of this, the propellers no longer spin freely. 

Overall:

As a $5.00 set, this is ideal. It has a vehicle, a bit of environment to add to the playability, treasure, and sea snakes. It isn’t overly complex, and offers a lovely selection of parts and creatures. The minifig is the archetype of the Aqua Raiders theme, and is accompanied by a decent amount of detail on the torso.
